body.p: Welcome to the fun world of migrating to DITA 2.0!
Still the same DITA you know and love, but now new and improved!

You want to take advantage of all these great new features, however DITA 2.0 is the first release that is not backwards compatible. You will need to migrate your existing source to be valid with the DITA 2.0 schema.
body.draft-comment:
Should this be divided by spec type? base vs technical content? or do we have one pass for all the things, with stuff broken out by spec?
WEK: I think covering everything as one unit is appropriate because that's the way DITA 1.x is organized.
body.p: This document is divided into sections:

dlentry.dd: What you need to do to make your DITA 1.x documents into conforming DITA 2.0 documents.
What you need to do to make your DITA 1.x-handling transformations also handle DITA 2.0 documents.

dlentry.dt: Migrating your DITA specializations and constraints
dlentry.dd: What you need to do to make your DITA 1.x specializations and constraints into DITA 2.0 specializations and constraints.
Migration considerations for other DITA-aware tools, such as editors and component content management systems.
